intro: Hieracium leucophaeum subsp. gremlii, commonly known as the white-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky soils, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are generally covered in a dense layer of white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
